title: All Ye Who Seek for Sure Relief

author.name: Henry W. Baker
author.bio: Henry Williams Baker was an English hymn writer and Anglican priest. He is best known for his hymns, which were included in 'Hymns Ancient and Modern,' a highly influential hymn book in the Anglican tradition.

lyrics:
All ye who seek for sure relief
In trouble and distress,
Whatever sorrow vex the mind,
Or guilt the soul,
Jesus who gave Himself for you
Upon the cross to die,
Opens to you His sacred heart;
O, to that heart draw nigh.

Ye hear how kindly He invites;
Ye hear His words so blest;
All ye that labour come to Me;
And I will give thee rest.

O, Jesus, joy of saints on high,
Thou hope of sinners here,
Attracted by those loving words
To thee we lift our prayer

Wash Thou our wounds
In that dear blood,
A new and contrite heart
On all who cry to Thee bestow.
